intro: Cystorchis dentifera, commonly known as the toothed orchid, is a flowering plant belonging to the Orchidaceae family. It is characterized by its delicate, lance-shaped leaves and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Native to Southeast Asia, this terrestrial orchid thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky crevices. The plant's unique morphology includes a short rhizome and specialized roots that aid in nutrient absorption. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest for both horticultural enthusiasts and botanical researchers.
